question.content:
**Which statement describes trade in Era 3 (6,000 BCE to 700 CE)?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: This is correct. Neighboring societies exchanged with one another regionally. Two of the largest trade networks of this era were in Afro-Eurasia and Mesoamerica, but smaller networks existed in almost all areas of the world.
choices.content: Societies in Era 3 participated in regional trade networks.

choices.clue: While you are right that societies did eventually participate in global trade, this phenomenon did not occur until Era 5 in the 1400s.
choices.content: Societies in Era 3 participated in global trade networks.

choices.clue: Trade networks expanded as neighboring societies became more interconnected during era 3.
choices.content: Societies in Era 3 participated in local trade only.

choices.clue: Oops! That’s not quite right, but smaller trade networks did expand significantly as societies became more interconnected during Era 3.
choices.content: Societies in Era 3 did not trade.
